Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: davidjworkman
Reviews.Content: We live in Northcentral Indiana and needed to stay overnight in Indianapolis. Had a very pleasant stay with an exceptionally friendly staff. Clean. Located close to the Interstate and some restaurants but very quiet. You do not get a complimentary breakfast but a very nice mini-type restaurant with breakfast and sandwich items. Starbucks served.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good breakfast, pool”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie34
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned to stay downtown but due to the women's NCAA games, we couldn't find a room. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The room was nice as per Marriott standards and had a balcony (although it's right by the freeway so not much of a view). There were 4 restaurants within 500 yards so we didn't even have to drive anywhere for dinner. The room had a fridge and microwave for our leftovers! The free breakfast coupon got us a cooked-to-order, full breakfast with coffee at the lobby eatery. Our 4 year old loved the pool and hot tub! As for the noise, given it's next to the freeway, we ran the fan on low all night and slept like the dead! This was a good value within 10 minutes-ish of downtown Indy and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for easy access to downtown Indianapolis”
Reviews.Author: esd3104
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our base for a weekend to visit downtown Indianapolis without having to pay a premium for actually being in the downtown area, and it was perfect for this. We could easily jump on the highway and be in downtown within 10 minutes, but the hotel was in a quite area with some other hotels, set back from any big noisy roads . Lobby is new and modern, with the little restaurant being perfect for me to get my morning oatmeal. The room was your standard Marriott room and was clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelseymom
Reviews.Content: We were in Greenwood to see family for New Year's. The courtyard was a nice hotel. The room was clean and the lobby was nice. We could not get wifi in the room. The hotel was very loud leading up to midnight but it was New Year's eve. We will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, great value!”
Reviews.Author: GPTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night, wish we had more. Very nice room, awesome bed with memory foam topper. We asked for a balcony room so we could sit outside and enjoy a relaxing drink. Lobby was just refurbed and is very nice, with small restaurant, Starbucks coffees, and small convenience store. Pool and hot tub looked great, but we didn't get time to use them. Staff was all very friendly. Great location, with several upscale restaurant/pubs within walking distance. Best of all.. the rate was only $90.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Redux”
Reviews.Author: purplevegas
Reviews.Content: I am usually a huge fan of any hotel in the Marriott family, but I have to say that this hotel was a huge disappointment for me. I was redeeming points for a free night while visiting friends in the area and thought I'd try the Courtyard since I seem to usually only stay at Fairfield hotels when I travel. The hotel sits kind of far off the main road but is quite close to two restaurants (although I wouldn't recommend walking to them, even in summer). Upon arrival in the parking lot, I found it a little odd that there were no more than a handful of cars in the lot on a Friday night. The lobby seems recently redone and very up-to-date and check-in was a breeze, even though the hotel's internet was down and everything had to be done manually. The hotel only has three floors and my room was located on the third floor, which also appeared to be recently redecorated. As for the room....eh. It almost looks like this hotel used to be something else and they've tried to bring it up to Marriott standards. The room had a large sliding glass door with a small balcony, which might be its best selling point. The bathroom had a sink area outside the tub/toilet area, which I always associate with low-rent hotels. The small closet shared the space with the external sink, which made the area look rather tacky. The tub/toilet area had a switch outside the bathroom, which was a little odd, and the room itself was rather gloomy. The tub seemed a little small, even with the bent shower bar to lend the illusion of more space. The shower had good water pressure, though. As for the sleeping area, there was a king size bed, a dresser with a flat screen tv on it, a mini fridge (with a microwave sitting on top of it), a desk and chair, a couch, and a coffee table all crammed into this one room. With the dresser, fridge, and desk lined up along one wall, it gave the impression that "Well, we had to put it somewhere". It just felt rather cluttered. The bed was extremely comfortable, though, and I got a great night's rest. The fitness room was a little lacking, with free weights, three treadmills, and one elliptical machine. No one was using the pool or the fitness room while I was there. The lobby has a public area that also serves light meals, but with the breakfast ending at 10AM on a Saturday, I was unable to try anything there. Overall, I won't be staying at this hotel again. There is a Fairfield on the same road and I think I'll give it a try next time, as this simply didn't live up to my standards in a Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sp8holly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a very long weekend in Indianapolis for a wedding. I am a huge Marriott fan and this Courtyard did not disappoint. This is a traditional Courtyard by Marriott but what sets it apart is the outstanding staff. The staff is kind, hard working and so accomodating. They could not do enough for me as I was using the meeting room while I stayed there. Plus the entire property was spotless. Located in the Southport area of Indy, it is the best place to stay in Indianapolis. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Small for a Courtyard--an avg box motel in a sea of similar lodgings”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisTrvlr
Reviews.Content: As we drove up to the hotel, we passed several other similar rectangular hotels--basic highway motels of every brand and color, and this one was no different. We stay at Courtyards almost exclusivetly, and the only thing similar with this location was the artwork and furniture coverings. The king room (207) was very tiny. The bedskirt was frayed and unhemmed. The bed was saggy at the edges. If we were not paying the premium $124/night we never would have guessed we were in a Courtyard. And unlike the typical motels, this one does the usual Courtyard thing of actually charging extra for the breakfast. Add insult to injury! The only way they can salvage this stiuation is to rename it what it is, as a Fairview Inn-- at least you would get what you are expecting. They should not charge this much for this hotel/ location. I felt decieved. The key entry system to the outside doors were broken, and desk staff acted like it was a new problem every time it was mentioned. At least they were nice and friendly, but you get the feeling they are just college students doing their shift--not invested in the success or failure of this hotel. The light under the door was glaring--we had to use towels to block it. For whatever reason, our door had a big gap under it, whereas others didn't. Parking was insufficient in the number of spaces--always filled, and there is a closed restaurant next door. I would not recommend this to anyone unless you have no choice and need to pay this much for so little.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachYiaYia
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay at this hotel again. All Marriott Courtyards are now completely non-smoking. Typical rooms, indoor pool and spa with a very attractive landscaped outdoor sitting area. There are numerous restaurants nearby and the interstate is easily accessible. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: summer1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Final Four from 3/28 to 4/4/06. The location was about a 15 minute easy drive to downtown. It has a few chain restaurants in the area. It offers a morning breakfast for $7.95. The room was clean but small. Bed was comfortable. I'm really fussy about the room and bed and I felt just fine. Our friends got a smoking room and were moved quickly to a non-smoking. People were friendly. Only one inconvenience, we had travelers check and they would rather not cash them for us, so we went to the bank across the street. Not a big problem. If we go to the Final Four again in 2010 and can not get a room downtown we will definitely try to get a room at this hotel. One funny thing the maid kept turning the heat on, the room was sooo hot when we would come back at night.

Reviews.Title: “There on business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I attended the annual Powersports Dealer Expo at the Convention Center. We stayed in a (spa/king room) room with a king size bed and a spa. The spa is still the best ones we have ever been in. Very comfortable for 2 people and it was located in the bedroom which was a great touch (could watch TV from it). Most hotels that offer a spa or whirlpool are located in the bathroom and too small for 2 people. We also enjoyed dinner at Carrabas Italian Resteraunt (great food) and the Texas Roadhouse which are both adjacent to the hotel (2 minutes walking distance). All in all I had no complaints of our stay and booked the same room again this year. I'm keeping my fingers crossed that we have another great experience.
